Package classes

Contains the classes necessary to implement a blacjack game with three game modes: interactive, debug and simulation.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Basic
    Implements the basic strategy of a blackjack game there is no card counting involved, the only variables are the player and dealer's hand.
    Card
    Implements a card in a blackjack game.
    Dealer
    Implements a dealer in a blackjack game.
    Debug
    The debug class is one of three game modes, it does not involve a player directly, as there are no commands to be typed.
    Game
    The abstract class game is the "interface" for all the game modes.
    Hand
    Implements a hand in blackjack.
    HiLo
    Implements the high-low strategy in a blackjack game.
    Interactive
    Implements one of the three possible game modes.
    Main
    The main function, which reads the input arguments and decides which game mode to be played.
    Player
    A player is the one making plays, although it is created a player in each game mode, only in the interactive mode does the player have a chance to freely choose his moves.
    Shoe
    The shoe class is where the cards to be played with are stored.
    Simulation
    The simulation class implements one of three possible game modes.
    Strategy
    The strategy class is the "interface" for both the basic and high-low strategies.

Package classes Description

Contains the classes necessary to implement a blacjack game with three game modes: interactive, debug and simulation. Contains strategies that might help the player to make the best moves.
